Posts.EditableText: http://docs.textadventures.co.uk/quest/ ... tlist.html talks about object lists, but in going through the GUI for various object types, I'm not seeing object list among them. I see string list, and object, but not object list.
Posts.HTML: http://docs.textadventures.co.uk/quest/ ... tlist.html talks about object lists, but in going through the GUI for various object types, I'm not seeing object list among them. I see string list, and object, but not object list.

Posts.EditableText: I think it just got missed from the GUI. They are way to useful to get rid of, Quest uses them internally a lot.
Posts.HTML: I think it just got missed from the GUI. They are way to useful to get rid of, Quest uses them internally a lot.

Posts.EditableText: Objectlists still exist, but you got to code them in yourself... for some reason, they got left out from the GUI~Editor's options.
Posts.HTML: Objectlists still exist, but you got to code them in yourself... for some reason, they got left out from the GUI~Editor's options.

Posts.EditableText: Bummer, I do everything through the GUI.  So much for that. Thanks for letting me know.
Posts.HTML: Bummer, I do everything through the GUI.  So much for that. Thanks for letting me know.

Posts.EditableText:
Just to be clear, you can still use object lists in the GUI. What you cannot do is set them to be attributes of an object, on the Attributes tab.

For example:
[attachment=0:3rd0n6i0]<!-- ia0 -->objectlist.png<!-- ia0 -->[/attachment:3rd0n6i0]
